Packing a spare set of clothes is a great idea, especially if you're concerned about unexpected delays or lost luggage. This is a common practice among travelers, and it's known as a "just in case" or "emergency" outfit.

Here's why it's a good idea:

* Delays and lost luggage can happen to anyone, and having a spare set of clothes can help you feel more prepared and less stressed.
* A spare outfit can also come in handy if you encounter unexpected weather changes or spills during your trip.
* If you're planning to visit multiple destinations or engage in outdoor activities, a spare set of clothes can be a lifesaver.

When packing a spare set of clothes, consider the following:

* Pack lightweight and versatile items that can be mixed and matched with your main outfits.
* Choose items that can be easily washed and dried if needed.
* Consider packing a spare set of undergarments, socks, and a lightweight top or dress.
* Roll your spare clothes tightly to save space in your backpack.

Some popular items to include in your spare set of clothes are:

* A lightweight rain jacket or poncho
* A spare pair of socks and undergarments
* A quick-drying travel towel
* A lightweight, packable dress or jumpsuit
* A spare pair of comfortable walking shoes or sneakers

Remember to pack your spare clothes in a separate, easily accessible compartment of your backpack, so you can quickly grab them if needed.

In your case, since you're planning to pack light, you might want to consider packing a minimal spare set of clothes, such as a spare pair of socks, undergarments, and a lightweight top. This will give you some peace of mind without adding too much bulk to your backpack.
